questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site is known as the 'Lost City of the Incas' and is located in the Andes Mountains of Peru?
questions.context: Built in the 15th century and later abandoned, this site was largely forgotten until its rediscovery by Hiram Bingham in 1911.

questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel, located in Sydney, Australia, stands out with its unique sail-like design and serves as a premier venue for performing arts?
questions.context: Opened in 1973, it is one of the 20th century's most famous and distinctive buildings.

questions.question: At which famous museum in Paris can you find the Mona Lisa, a masterpiece painted by Leonardo da Vinci?
questions.context: This museum, once a royal palace, houses one of the world's largest art collections and was first opened to the public in 1793.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin in Jordan is known for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system, often referred to as the 'Rose City'?
questions.context: Established possibly as early as 5th century BC, it became a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1985.

questions.question: Which space exploration site, located in Florida, has been the launch site for every American human space flight since 1968?
questions.context: Opened in 1968, it serves as NASA's primary launch center and was the site of the famous Apollo 11 launch.
